title.narrative: Supporting the Socioeconomic Reintegration of Sri Lankan Migrant Workers Repatriated Due to the COVID-19 Outbreak

description.narrative: The project is consistent with the strategic priorities identified by the Government of Sri Lanka for the reintegration of returnee migrant workers in the National COVID-19 response plan for migrant workers. The project focuses on skills development, infrastructure development at district level, safe migration awareness and career guidance to reduce vulnerabilities of aspirant and returnee migrants, mental health and psychosocial support, business / entrepreneurship development, upgrading equipment and infrastructure at vocational training institutes that will benefit the returnees and the host communities. The project has 3 key outcomes. First, migrant returnees impacted by COVID-19 have sustained or restored their livelihoods through community infrastructure or access to employment opportunities and are able to take ownership of their recovery processes along with their communities and local administrations. Second, Reduced vulnerability of returnee migrant workers through enhanced skills development for future employment opportunities. Third, improved capacity of government institutions facilitates consistent economic participation of migrant returnees.
